page.title: 05UPHOLLAND COLLEGE
page.content: This College is the only{Roman {Catholic Junior Seminary}in England. Its grounds cover 263 acres and include farmland, playing fields and a golf course. The land was bought by Bishop O'Reilly in 1877 for Â£8000 and the building is built from local stone. It opened in 1883. In 1923 extensions were needed and in 1930 a fine chapel was built while in 1936 the staff built their own gym. The College educates boys to 'A' level standard and they then go to Senior Seminaries in England, Ireland or Rome. The Upholland Northern Institute is housed in the same building and runs adult Christian education courses and acts as a conference and retreat centre. Archbishop Derek Warlock is committed to its continued existence.
